intro: Lindernia bampsii, commonly known as the Cape York lindernia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet to purple blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lindernia bampsii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
